stories.story_name: Refactor ProcureSight Site Tab Search Functionality
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User is on the ProcureSight Site tab **WHEN**: User enters search terms and clicks search **THEN**: Results are displayed using the new ProcureSight+ Module interface with procurement cards showing Add to Collection and Save to Requirement actions

**GIVEN**: User has search results displayed **WHEN**: User clicks on a procurement result card **THEN**: Procurement Summary view opens with all procurement data and links to Vendor Summary and Codes Summary
**GIVEN**: User is viewing procurement documents **WHEN**: User clicks on a document from search results **THEN**: Native AI Chat interface opens allowing user to chat with the selected document

**GIVEN**: User is on Requirement Summary **WHEN**: User navigates to the insights section **THEN**: Tab structure shows Research, Bookmarks, Search, Documents, and Best in Class tabs with appropriate content

stories.story_name: Enable Search Tab in Requirement Summary
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User is on the Search tab in Requirement Summary **WHEN**: User performs a search **THEN**: Global search interface displays with recent searches and Save to Requirement action available on results

**GIVEN**: User has saved procurements to requirement **WHEN**: User clicks Save to Requirement action **THEN**: Procurement is saved and displayed in the Bookmarks tab with ability to view details and remove
**GIVEN**: User navigates to Collections tab **WHEN**: User views the collections grid **THEN**: Updated UX displays as per mockup specifications with improved layout and navigation

stories.story_name: Implement Collection Summary Page with Tabs
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: User opens a collection **WHEN**: User views collection summary **THEN**: Three tabs are available - Bookmarks, Documents, and Insights with respective content from saved procurements
**GIVEN**: New ProcureSight+ Module is integrated **WHEN**: Development team refactors existing code **THEN**: All legacy PS integration code is removed and replaced with new backend API calls
**GIVEN**: User has search results displayed **WHEN**: User clicks Add to Collection action **THEN**: Procurement is added to selected collection and user receives confirmation
